ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9

about.description:
FedFred is a Python package for interacting with the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis Economic Database (FRED API).
It provides a feature-rich interface with:
- Pandas/Polars DataFrame outputs
- Native support for asynchronous requests
- Local caching for faster execution
- GeoPandas outputs for geographical data (FRED-Maps/GeoFRED)
- MyPy compatible type stubs
about.summary: A feature-rich python package for interacting with the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis Economic Database (FRED)

about.description:
FedFred is a Python package for interacting with the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis Economic Database (FRED API).
It provides a feature-rich interface with:
- Pandas/Polars DataFrame outputs
- Native support for asynchronous requests
- Local caching for faster execution
- GeoPandas outputs for geographical data (FRED-Maps/GeoFRED)
- MyPy compatible type stubs
about.summary: A feature-rich python package for interacting with the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis Economic Database (FRED)

name: fedfred
raw_meta_yaml:
package:
  name: fedfred
  version: 3.0.0

source:
  url: "https://pypi.io/packages/source/f/fedfred/fedfred-3.0.0.tar.gz"
  sha256: "5742ff591b37d49b18a856f98e6fc45953ba8227e48aaf7b3c7c2d9d59e14e06"

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: |
    python -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.9,<4.0
    - pip
    - poetry-core >=1.0.0
  run:
    - python >=3.9,<4.0
    - httpx
    - tenacity
    - pandas
    - geopandas
    - conda-forge::polars
    - conda-forge::cachetools
    - conda-forge::asyncache
    - conda-forge::dask
    - conda-forge::dask-geopandas

test:
  imports:
    - fedfred
  requires:
    - pip
  commands:
    - pip check

about:
  home: "https://github.com/nikhilxsunder/fedfred"
  doc_url: "https://nikhilxsunder.github.io/fedfred/"
  dev_url: "https://github.com/nikhilxsunder/fedfred"
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: "A feature-rich python package for interacting with the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis Economic Database (FRED)"
  description: |
    FedFred is a Python package for interacting with the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis Economic Database (FRED API).
    It provides a feature-rich interface with:
    - Pandas/Polars DataFrame outputs
    - Native support for asynchronous requests
    - Local caching for faster execution
    - GeoPandas outputs for geographical data (FRED-Maps/GeoFRED)
    - MyPy compatible type stubs

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - nikhilxsunder
